posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
This was an interesting idea I fleshed out tonight.

Elven Rogue ITWF Kukri with  Keen Senses, 300 odd skill points, HiPS with Hide/Move Silently scores in their 60s, 13d6 sneak attack, Epic Dodge, Evasion with a reflex save of 40

Aware of concerns about damage output against sneak immunes with damage resistance ie constructs/undead so I pumped strength a little (up to +12 str modifier capped). 

Got the HP up to 370 odd but was tough work

Could have gone Rogue / Fighter I guess for +6 damage from WS/EWS but 20% exp penalty with that and I'm funny about that even on a PW. Maybe I'll get over it eventually

The +5 to saves from CoT is really nice though...

I know at one time there were a few threads about shadowdancers and amounts of levels.. and if I recall, GDL even did a SD 20 build once..

pimped = their special abilities were upped a little.. I think it was to make up for the HiPs cooldown that was imposed...

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I was very much tempted to get SD 10 for the shadow lord summon but also defensive roll, improved evasion and slippery mind for free! SD also gets d8 hit die which is nice too. That Shadowlord summon is pretty nasty!

I decided to not go for it and get more sneak attack / skills from rogue instead I shall think on this, good to leave a nice distraction for enemies to attack... whilst you sneak attack...

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Nice build, Orion.

You don't need to worry about your dmg however, umd & itwf will cover this in situations where you aren't allowed the use of sneak attack. I would pump dexterity to the maximum instead, getting these sweet +3AB & AC points, however. I would also not worry about your hide & move silently scores since they are gonna be even higher in-game because dexterity is your main stat & instead take additional sneak attacks and/or skill mastery. Also, CoT isn't only giving your build +5 saves but more since it has two good saves & when is used pre-epic confers even better results.
